strings.Value: "It's not like we're hiding our relationship, Valerie..."
"Are you saying it's time for us to get married?"
"And yet, you're the girl I chose."
"I know, Valerie. You are amazing, and these simpletons are too stupid to even notice!"
"Don't listen to them. Who knows better than you how little their words mean?"
"If you don't like anything about our situation, we can always go our separate ways."

"You're not going to believe what I heard!" {n}Valerie is bursting with indignation.{/n} "Some insolent wench saw me on the street and called me... the {mf|baron's|baroness'|King's|Queen's} favorite!"
"No! That's not what I'm talking about!" {n}Valerie raises her hands and drops them helplessly.{/n} "Great gods, do you really not understand?"
"How can I not pay attention to this? How..." {n}Valerie raises her hands, and drops them helplessly.{/n} "Great gods, do you not understand?"

"I'm your companion. A servant to the crown. Protector of these lands. I've gone through thick and thin with you, I've been in so many brawls... and all they whisper behind my back is that I'm your woman!"
{n}Valerie's face turns to stone.{/n} "Not any more. I hope the new girl of your choice will appreciate the exalted attention."
{n}Valerie sizes you up.{/n} "Well... if you don't see a problem where I see one, that means we should put an end to this. Before it causes any problems."
{n}Valerie loses her speech for a moment — and then happily laughs like a mischievous little girl.{/n} "{name}! You are such a flatterer! You made me laugh!"
{n}Valerie quickly kisses you and pulls away.{/n} "Thank you. Let's go."
"Oh... you're right. Forgive me, I overreacted. I don't know why. But it hurt like a knife in the heart. — It's like nothing I do even matters!"
